meanings.definition: Adjusted or corrected to a new standard or scale.
meanings.sent1: The recalibrated scale showed the correct weight of the object.
meanings.sent2: The recalibrated thermometer provided accurate temperature readings.
meanings.sent3: The recalibrated ruler decided it was time to measure up to the competition.
meanings.sent4: Her recalibrated mindset allowed her to see things from a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: The recalibrated compass guided them through the dense forest with precision.

meanings.definition: Made changes to improve accuracy or precision.
meanings.sent1: He recalibrated the machine to ensure it operated smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic recalibrated the engine for better performance.
meanings.sent3: The chef recalibrated the recipe, hoping to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: She recalibrated her aim and hit the bullseye on her first try.
meanings.sent5: The scientist recalibrated the telescope to observe distant galaxies.
